content.description: The rhythm is three measures long. The first and third measures are given below.
content.question: Which of the following rhythmic patterns is played in the second measure?

choices.label: One measure in treble clef. Eighth notes E-flat 5, D5, quarter C5, eighth notes B-flat 4, C5, quarter F4.
One measure in treble clef. Eighth notes E-flat 5, D5, C5, B-flat 4, quarter notes C5, F4.
One measure in treble clef. Quarter E-flat 5, eighth notes D5, C5, quarter B-flat 4, eighth notes C5, F4.
One measure in treble clef. Quarter notes E-flat 5, D5, eighth notes C5, B-flat 4, C5, F4.

content.answer: One measure in treble clef. Eighth notes E-flat 5, D5, C5, B-flat 4, quarter notes C5, F4.

unit.text: 1: Music Fundamentals I - Pitch, Major Scales and Key Signatures, Rhythm, Meter, and Expressive Elements

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Use symbols and terms to describe features of rhythm in performed music, including meter, note values, and rhythmic patterns and devices.
